Creating a DIY satellite kit that can be assembled by kids or beginners to learn about space and technology.
Developing an app that uses GPS data to track and locate satellites in real-time, allowing users to see where they are in relation to space objects.
Launching a social media campaign that encourages people to share photos and videos of themselves looking up at the night sky, using the hashtag #SatelliteSpotter.
Partnering with a non-profit organization to launch a satellite for environmental monitoring purposes, such as tracking deforestation or ocean pollution.
Hosting a hackathon that challenges teams to come up with innovative ways to use satellites, such as developing new technologies or applications that rely on satellite data.
